messages.text:
プロジェクトチャンネルにご参加の皆様 Code for Japanコミュニティ担当のくぼっち(窪田)です。  
 初めてコミュニティに入ってきた方にもプロジェクトチャネルが一覧しやすいように、毎年Slackの定期メンテナンスを行なっております。6ヶ月以上更新がないチャンネルを順次アーカイブしていきます。（*削除ではなく、検索などから履歴の閲覧・復活はできますのでご安心ください。*）  
  こちらのチャンネルは半年以上更新がないため、今回この対象となります。プロジェクト再開の目処が立っている・今後の活動についてチャネル内で議論しておきたいなどの場合は、2024年1月10日(水)までに <https://api.threado.com/api/link/?id=3417468|@くぼっち> 宛にメンションをつけてお声掛けください。  
 それではみなさん素敵なクリスマスとお正月をお過ごしください :smile:

text.text: プロジェクトチャンネルにご参加の皆様 Code for Japanコミュニティ担当のくぼっち(窪田)です。
初めてコミュニティに入ってきた方にもプロジェクトチャネルが一覧しやすいように、毎年Slackの定期メンテナンスを行なっております。6ヶ月以上更新がないチャンネルを順次アーカイブしていきます。（*削除ではなく、検索などから履歴の閲覧・復活はできますのでご安心ください。*）
こちらのチャンネルは半年以上更新がないため、今回この対象となります。プロジェクト再開の目処が立っている・今後の活動についてチャネル内で議論しておきたいなどの場合は、2024年1月10日(水)までに <https://api.threado.com/api/link/?id=3417468|@くぼっち> 宛にメンションをつけてお声掛けください。
それではみなさん素敵なクリスマスとお正月をお過ごしください :smile:

Bumps <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri|nokogiri> from 1.12.5 to 1.14.3.

Release notes

_Sourced from <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/releases|nokogiri's releases>._

> *1.14.3 / 2023-04-11*
> *Security*
> 
> • [CRuby] Vendored libxml2 is updated to address CVE-2023-29469, CVE-2023-28484, and one other security-related issue. See <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/security/advisories/GHSA-pxvg-2qj5-37jq|GHSA-pxvg-2qj5-37jqGHSA-pxvg-2qj5-37jq> for more information.
> 
> *Dependencies*
> 
> • [CRuby] Vendored libxml2 is updated to <https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/-/releases/v2.10.4|v2.10.4> from v2.10.3.
> 
> * * *
>

>

>

Changelog

_Sourced from <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md|nokogiri's changelog>._

> *1.14.3 / 2023-04-11*
> *Security*
> 
> • [CRuby] Vendored libxml2 is updated to address CVE-2023-29469, CVE-2023-28484, and one other security-related issue. See <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/security/advisories/GHSA-pxvg-2qj5-37jq|GHSA-pxvg-2qj5-37jqGHSA-pxvg-2qj5-37jq> for more information.
> 
> *Dependencies*
> 
> • [CRuby] Vendored libxml2 is updated to <https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/libxml2/-/releases/v2.10.4|v2.10.4> from v2.10.3.
> 
> *1.14.2 / 2023-02-13*
> *Fixed*
> 
> • Calling `NodeSet#to_html` on an empty node set no longer raises an encoding-related exception. This bug was introduced in v1.14.0 while fixing <https://redirect.github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/issues/2649|#2649>. [<https://redirect.github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/issues/2784|#2784>]
> 
> *1.14.1 / 2023-01-30*
> *Fixed*
> 
> • Serializing documents now works again with pseudo-IO objects that don't support IO's encoding API (like rubyzip's `Zip::OutputStream`). This was a regression in v1.14.0 due to the fix for <https://redirect.github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/issues/752|#752> in <https://redirect.github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/issues/2434|#2434>, and was not completely fixed by <https://redirect.github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/issues/2753|#2753>. [<https://redirect.github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/issues/2773|#2773>]
> • [CRuby] Address compiler warnings about `void*` casting and old-style C function definitions.
> 
> *1.14.0 / 2023-01-12*
> *Notable Changes*
> *Ruby*
> 
> This release introduces native gem support for Ruby 3.2. (Also see "Technical note" under "Changed" below.)
> 
> This release ends support for:
> 
> • Ruby 2.6, for which <https://www.ruby-lang.org/en/downloads/branches/|upstream support ended 2022-04-12>.
> • JRuby 9.3, which is not fully compatible with Ruby 2.7+
> 
> *Faster, more reliable installation: Native Gem for `aarch64-linux` (aka `linux/arm64/v8`)*
> 
> This version of Nokogiri ships _official_ native gem support for the `aarch64-linux` platform, which should support AWS Graviton and other ARM64 Linux platforms. Please note that glibc >= 2.29 is required for aarch64-linux systems, see <https://nokogiri.org/#supported-platforms|Supported Platforms> for more information.
> 
> *Faster, more reliable installation: Native Gem for `arm-linux` (aka `linux/arm/v7`)*
> 
> This version of Nokogiri ships _experimental_ native gem support for the `arm-linux` platform. Please note that glibc >= 2.29 is required for arm-linux systems, see <https://nokogiri.org/#supported-platforms|Supported Platforms> for more information.

... (truncated)

Commits

• <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/commit/e8d2f4a829c50e6ad4ccd1625cd094e3a24acf36|`e8d2f4a`> version bump to v1.14.3
• <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/commit/59fbc7b6d5cecad921cc24daa34d69bbda8713fb|`59fbc7b`> doc: update CHANGELOG for v1.14.3
• <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/commit/347eacbeeacd2be0140faede75395bd1ed01073f|`347eacb`> Merge pull request <https://redirect.github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/issues/2852|#2852> from sparklemotion/flavorjones-libxml2-2.10.4-backport
• <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/commit/36b0b3355d6d0d45bfdf1b55012bccfb348a6b4f|`36b0b33`> dep: update libxml2 to 2.10.4 from 2.10.3
• <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/commit/ac83e6ee7011ce9fec24399c759a73fb924a0de6|`ac83e6e`> test: update behavior of namespaces in HTML4
• <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/commit/2cf4996c5280f93e1ea66b2aceeed848d57fbe01|`2cf4996`> test: make default GC behavior "normal"
• <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/commit/1580121eeae3c1f266c4012d22d61314aa3202b7|`1580121`> version bump to v1.14.2
• <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/commit/530947753e3074d551217ea6bce7b4bbbc1234a9|`5309477`> Merge pull request <https://redirect.github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/issues/2791|#2791> from sparklemotion/2784-encoding-empty-strings-v1.14.x
• <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/commit/975ae491c4993ff47e36262dc8e305fa2d651bf4|`975ae49`> doc: update CHANGELOG
• <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/commit/f13cdb46406c9b119a368cf506d831865dd95163|`f13cdb4`> fix: empty node set serialization when document encoding is nil
• Additional commits viewable in <https://github.com/sparklemotion/nokogiri/compare/v1.12.5...v1.14.3|compare view>

attachments.text:
Bumps <https://github.com/rack/rack|rack> from 2.2.3 to 2.2.6.3.

Changelog

_Sourced from <https://github.com/rack/rack/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md|rack's changelog>._

> *Changelog*
> 
> All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. For info on how to format all future additions to this file please reference <https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/|Keep A Changelog>.
> 
> *[Unreleased]*
> *SPEC Changes*
> 
> • `rack.input` is now optional. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1997|#1997>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> 
> *Changed*
> 
> • `rack.input` is now optional, and if missing, will raise an error. Use this to fail on multipart parsing a request without an input body. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/2018|#2018>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> • Introduce `module Rack::BadRequest` which is included in multipart and query parser errors. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/2019|#2019>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> • MIME type for JavaScript files (`.js`) changed from `application/javascript` to `text/javascript` (<https://github.com/rack/rack/commit/1bd0f1597d8f4a90d47115f3e156a8ce7870c9c8|`1bd0f15`>)
> 
> *[3.0.4.1] - 2023-01-17*
> 
> • [<https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-93pm-5p5f-3ghx|CVE-2022-44571>] Fix ReDoS vulnerability in multipart parser
> • [<https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-65f5-mfpf-vfhj|CVE-2022-44570>] Fix ReDoS in Rack::Utils.get_byte_ranges
> • [<https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rqv2-275x-2jq5|CVE-2022-44572>] Forbid control characters in attributes (also ReDoS)
> 
> *[3.0.4] - 2023-01-17*
> 
> • `Rack::Request#POST` should consistently raise errors. Cache errors that occur when invoking `Rack::Request#POST` so they can be raised again later. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/2010|#2010>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> • Fix `Rack::Lint` error message for `HTTP_CONTENT_TYPE` and `HTTP_CONTENT_LENGTH`. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/2007|#2007>, <https://github.com/byroot|`@​byroot`>)
> • Extend `Rack::MethodOverride` to handle `QueryParser::ParamsTooDeepError` error. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/2006|#2006>, <https://github.com/byroot|`@​byroot`>)
> 
> *[3.0.3] - 2022-12-27*
> *Fixed*
> 
> • `Rack::URLMap` uses non-deprecated form of `Regexp.new`. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1998|#1998>, <https://github.com/weizheheng|`@​weizheheng`>)
> 
> *[3.0.2] -2022-12-05*
> *Fixed*
> 
> • `Utils.build_nested_query` URL-encodes nested field names including the square brackets.
> • Allow `Rack::Response` to pass through streaming bodies. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1993|#1993>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> 
> *[3.0.1] - 2022-11-18*
> *Fixed*
> 
> • `MethodOverride` does not look for an override if a request does not include form/parseable data.
> • `Rack::Lint::Wrapper` correctly handles `respond_to?` with `to_ary`, `each`, `call` and `to_path`, forwarding to the body. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1981|#1981>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> 
> *[3.0.0] - 2022-09-06*

... (truncated)

Commits

• <https://github.com/rack/rack/commit/d6b5b2bab88f458fb048133604faebea952d8133|`d6b5b2b`> bump version
• <https://github.com/rack/rack/commit/9aac3757fe19cdb0476504c9245170115bec9668|`9aac375`> Limit all multipart parts, not just files
• <https://github.com/rack/rack/commit/2606ac5d5d180c00a8cbcaa4d634276bab06500e|`2606ac5`> bumping version
• <https://github.com/rack/rack/commit/f6d4f528f2df1318a6612845db0b59adc7fe8fc1|`f6d4f52`> Fix ReDoS in Rack::Utils.get_byte_ranges
• <https://github.com/rack/rack/commit/20bc90c2431d7fabcd1873410543cf3d72f65004|`20bc90c`> bump version
• <https://github.com/rack/rack/commit/3677f170b4ac713defb84cd6a86431623ba0adc0|`3677f17`> Update changelog
• <https://github.com/rack/rack/commit/ee25ab9a7ee981d7578f559701085b0cf39bde77|`ee25ab9`> Fix ReDoS vulnerability in multipart parser
• <https://github.com/rack/rack/commit/19e49f0f185d7e42ed5b402baec6c897a8c48029|`19e49f0`> Forbid control characters in attributes
• <https://github.com/rack/rack/commit/ea39e49442e0008bfce4ad628ce52a4be2a20b5b|`ea39e49`> Bump patch version.
• <https://github.com/rack/rack/commit/c0f9de4844052b7867180c587d1b6969be2f114d|`c0f9de4`> Rack::MethodOverride handle QueryParser::ParamsTooDeepError (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/2011|#2011>)
• Additional commits viewable in <https://github.com/rack/rack/compare/2.2.3...v2.2.6.3|compare view>

Changelog

_Sourced from <https://github.com/rack/rack/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md|rack's changelog>._

> *Changelog*
> 
> All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. For info on how to format all future additions to this file please reference <https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/|Keep A Changelog>.
> 
> *[3.0.7] - 2023-03-16*
> 
> • Make query parameters without `=` have `nil` values. (<https://redirect.github.com/rack/rack/pull/2059|#2059>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> 
> *[3.0.6.1] - 2023-03-13*
> 
> • [<https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-c6qg-cjj8-47qp|CVE-2023-27539>] Avoid ReDoS in header parsing
> 
> *[3.0.6] - 2023-03-13*
> 
> • Add `QueryParser#missing_value` for handling missing values + tests. (<https://redirect.github.com/rack/rack/pull/2052|#2052>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> 
> *[3.0.5] - 2023-03-13*
> 
> • Split form/query parsing into two steps. (<https://redirect.github.com/rack/rack/pull/2038|#2038>, <https://github.com/matthewd|`@​matthewd`>)
> 
> *[3.0.4.1] - 2023-03-02*
> *SPEC Changes*
> 
> • `rack.input` is now optional. (<https://redirect.github.com/rack/rack/pull/1997|#1997>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> 
> *Changed*
> 
> • `rack.input` is now optional, and if missing, will raise an error. Use this to fail on multipart parsing a request without an input body. (<https://redirect.github.com/rack/rack/pull/2018|#2018>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> • Introduce `module Rack::BadRequest` which is included in multipart and query parser errors. (<https://redirect.github.com/rack/rack/pull/2019|#2019>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])

> • Add `.mjs` MIME type (<https://redirect.github.com/rack/rack/pull/2057|#2057>, [<https://github.com/axilleas|`@​axilleas`>])
> 
> *[3.0.4.1] - 2023-01-17*
> 
> • [<https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-93pm-5p5f-3ghx|CVE-2022-44571>] Fix ReDoS vulnerability in multipart parser
> • [<https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-65f5-mfpf-vfhj|CVE-2022-44570>] Fix ReDoS in Rack::Utils.get_byte_ranges
> • [<https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-rqv2-275x-2jq5|CVE-2022-44572>] Forbid control characters in attributes (also ReDoS)
> 
> *[3.0.4] - 2023-01-17*
>

_Sourced from <https://github.com/rack/rack/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md|rack's changelog>._

> *Changelog*
> 
> All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. For info on how to format all future additions to this file please reference <https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/|Keep A Changelog>.
> 
> *[3.0.3] - 2022-12-07*
> *Fixed*
> 
> • `Rack::URLMap` uses non-deprecated form of `Regexp.new`. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1998|#1998>, <https://github.com/weizheheng|`@​weizheheng`>)
> 
> *[3.0.2] -2022-12-05*
> *Fixed*
> 
> • `Utils.build_nested_query` URL-encodes nested field names including the square brackets.
> • Allow `Rack::Response` to pass through streaming bodies. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1993|#1993>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> 
> *[3.0.1] - 2022-11-18*
> *Fixed*
> 
> • `MethodOverride` does not look for an override if a request does not include form/parseable data.
> • `Rack::Lint::Wrapper` correctly handles `respond_to?` with `to_ary`, `each`, `call` and `to_path`, forwarding to the body. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1981|#1981>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> 
> *[3.0.0] - 2022-09-06*
> 
> • No changes
> 
> *[3.0.0.rc1] - 2022-09-04*
> *SPEC Changes*
> 
> • Stream argument must implement `<<` <https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1959|rack/rack#1959>
> • `close` may be called on `rack.input` <https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1956|rack/rack#1956>
> • `rack.response_finished` may be used for executing code after the response has been finished <https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1952|rack/rack#1952>
> 
> *[3.0.0.beta1] - 2022-08-08*
> *Security*
> 
> • Do not use semicolon as GET parameter separator. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1733|#1733>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> 
> *SPEC Changes*
> 
> • Response array must now be non-frozen.
> • Response `status` must now be an integer greater than or equal to 100.
> • Response `headers` must now be an unfrozen hash.
> • Response header keys can no longer include uppercase characters.
> • Response header values can be an `Array` to handle multiple values (and no longer supports `\n` encoded headers).
> • Response body can now respond to `#call` (streaming body) instead of `#each` (enumerable body), for the equivalent of response hijacking in previous versions.

Bumps <https://github.com/rack/rack|rack> from 2.2.3 to 2.2.3.1.

Changelog

_Sourced from <https://github.com/rack/rack/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md|rack's changelog>._

> *Changelog*
> 
> All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. For info on how to format all future additions to this file please reference <https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/|Keep A Changelog>.
> 
> *[3.0.0] - Unreleased*
> *Security*
> 
> • Do not use semicolon as GET parameter separator. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1733|#1733>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> 
> *SPEC Changes*
> 
> • Response `status` must now be an integer greater than or equal to 100.
> • Response `headers` must now be an unfrozen hash.
> • Response header keys can no longer include uppercase characters.
> • Response header values can be an `Array` to handle multiple values (and no longer supports `\n` encoded headers).
> • Response body can now respond to `#call` (streaming body) instead of `#each` (enumerable body), for the equivalent of response hijacking in previous versions.
> • Middleware must no longer call `#each` on the body, but they can call `#to_ary` on the body if it responds to `#to_ary`.
> • `rack.input` is no longer required to be rewindable.
> • `rack.multithread/rack.multiprocess/rack.run_once` are no longer required environment keys.
> • `SERVER_PROTOCOL` is now a required key, matching the HTTP protocol used in the request.
> 
> *Removed*
> 
> • Remove `rack.multithread`/`rack.multiprocess`/`rack.run_once`. These variables generally come too late to be useful. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1720|#1720>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>], [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>]))
> • Remove deprecated Rack::Request::SCHEME_WHITELIST. ([<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • Remove internal cookie deletion using pattern matching, there are very few practical cases where it would be useful and browsers handle it correctly without us doing anything special. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1844|#1844>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> 
> *Added*
> 
> • `Rack::Headers` added to support lower-case header keys. ([<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • `Rack::Utils#set_cookie_header` now supports `escape_key: false` to avoid key escaping. ([<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • `Rack::RewindableInput` supports size. (<https://github.com/ahorek|`@​ahorek`>)
> • `Rack::RewindableInput::Middleware` added for making `rack.input` rewindable. ([<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • The RFC 7239 Forwarded header is now supported and considered by default when looking for information on forwarding, falling back to the X-Forwarded-* headers. `Rack::Request.forwarded_priority` accessor has been added for configuring the priority of which header to check. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/1423|#1423>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • Allow response headers to contain array of values. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/1598|#1598>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> 
> *Changed*
> 
> • BREAKING CHANGE: Require `status` to be an Integer. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1662|#1662>, <https://github.com/olleolleolle|`@​olleolleolle`>)
> • BREAKING CHANGE: Query parsing now treats parameters without `=` as having the empty string value instead of nil value, to conform to the URL spec. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/1696|#1696>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • Relax validations around `Rack::Request#host` and `Rack::Request#hostname`. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/1606|#1606>, <https://github.com/pvande|`@​pvande`>)
> • Removed antiquated handlers: FCGI, LSWS, SCGI, Thin. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1658|#1658>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> • Removed options from `Rack::Builder.parse_file` and `Rack::Builder.load_file`. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1663|#1663>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> • `Rack::HTTP_VERSION` has been removed and the `HTTP_VERSION` env setting is no longer set in the CGI and Webrick handlers. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/970|#970>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • `Rack::Request#[]` and `#[]=` now warn even in non-verbose mode. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/1277|#1277>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • Decrease default allowed parameter recursion level from 100 to 32. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/1640|#1640>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • Attempting to parse a multipart response with an empty body now raises Rack::Multipart::EmptyContentError. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/1603|#1603>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • `Rack::Utils.secure_compare` uses OpenSSL's faster implementation if available. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1711|#1711>, <https://github.com/bdewater|`@​bdewater`>)
> • `Rack::Request#POST` now caches an empty hash if input content type is not parseable. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/749|#749>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])

Changelog

_Sourced from <https://github.com/rack/rack/blob/main/CHANGELOG.md|rack's changelog>._

> *Changelog*
> 
> All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. For info on how to format all future additions to this file please reference <https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/|Keep A Changelog>.
> 
> *[3.0.0] - Unreleased*
> *Security*
> 
> • Do not use semicolon as GET parameter separator. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1733|#1733>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> 
> *SPEC Changes*
> 
> • Response `status` must now be an integer greater than or equal to 100.
> • Response `headers` must now be an unfrozen hash.
> • Response header keys can no longer include uppercase characters.
> • Response header values can be an `Array` to handle multiple values (and no longer supports `\n` encoded headers).
> • Response body can now respond to `#call` (streaming body) instead of `#each` (enumerable body), for the equivalent of response hijacking in previous versions.
> • Middleware must no longer call `#each` on the body, but they can call `#to_ary` on the body if it responds to `#to_ary`.
> • `rack.input` is no longer required to be rewindable.
> • `rack.multithread/rack.multiprocess/rack.run_once` are no longer required environment keys.
> • `SERVER_PROTOCOL` is now a required key, matching the HTTP protocol used in the request.
> 
> *Removed*
> 
> • Remove `rack.multithread`/`rack.multiprocess`/`rack.run_once`. These variables generally come too late to be useful. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1720|#1720>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>], [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>]))
> • Remove deprecated Rack::Request::SCHEME_WHITELIST. ([<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • Remove internal cookie deletion using pattern matching, there are very few practical cases where it would be useful and browsers handle it correctly without us doing anything special. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1844|#1844>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> 
> *Added*
> 
> • `Rack::Headers` added to support lower-case header keys. ([<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • `Rack::Utils#set_cookie_header` now supports `escape_key: false` to avoid key escaping. ([<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • `Rack::RewindableInput` supports size. (<https://github.com/ahorek|`@​ahorek`>)
> • `Rack::RewindableInput::Middleware` added for making `rack.input` rewindable. ([<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • The RFC 7239 Forwarded header is now supported and considered by default when looking for information on forwarding, falling back to the X-Forwarded-* headers. `Rack::Request.forwarded_priority` accessor has been added for configuring the priority of which header to check. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/1423|#1423>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • Allow response headers to contain array of values. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/1598|#1598>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> 
> *Changed*
> 
> • BREAKING CHANGE: Require `status` to be an Integer. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1662|#1662>, <https://github.com/olleolleolle|`@​olleolleolle`>)
> • BREAKING CHANGE: Query parsing now treats parameters without `=` as having the empty string value instead of nil value, to conform to the URL spec. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/1696|#1696>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • Relax validations around `Rack::Request#host` and `Rack::Request#hostname`. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/1606|#1606>, <https://github.com/pvande|`@​pvande`>)
> • Removed antiquated handlers: FCGI, LSWS, SCGI, Thin. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1658|#1658>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> • Removed options from `Rack::Builder.parse_file` and `Rack::Builder.load_file`. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1663|#1663>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> • `Rack::HTTP_VERSION` has been removed and the `HTTP_VERSION` env setting is no longer set in the CGI and Webrick handlers. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/970|#970>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • `Rack::Request#[]` and `#[]=` now warn even in non-verbose mode. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/1277|#1277>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • Decrease default allowed parameter recursion level from 100 to 32. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/1640|#1640>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • Attempting to parse a multipart response with an empty body now raises Rack::Multipart::EmptyContentError. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/issues/1603|#1603>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> • `Rack::Utils.secure_compare` uses OpenSSL's faster implementation if available. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1711|#1711>, <https://github.com/bdewater|`@​bdewater`>)
> • `Rack::Request#POST` now caches an empty hash if input content type is not parseable. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/749|#749>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])

> *Changelog*
> 
> All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. For info on how to format all future additions to this file please reference <https://keepachangelog.com/en/1.0.0/|Keep A Changelog>.
> 
> *[3.0.3] - 2022-12-07*
> *Fixed*
> 
> • `Rack::URLMap` uses non-deprecated form of `Regexp.new`. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1998|#1998>, <https://github.com/weizheheng|`@​weizheheng`>)
> 
> *[3.0.2] -2022-12-05*
> *Fixed*
> 
> • `Utils.build_nested_query` URL-encodes nested field names including the square brackets.
> • Allow `Rack::Response` to pass through streaming bodies. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1993|#1993>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> 
> *[3.0.1] - 2022-11-18*
> *Fixed*
> 
> • `MethodOverride` does not look for an override if a request does not include form/parseable data.
> • `Rack::Lint::Wrapper` correctly handles `respond_to?` with `to_ary`, `each`, `call` and `to_path`, forwarding to the body. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1981|#1981>, [<https://github.com/ioquatix|`@​ioquatix`>])
> 
> *[3.0.0] - 2022-09-06*
> 
> • No changes
> 
> *[3.0.0.rc1] - 2022-09-04*
> *SPEC Changes*
> 
> • Stream argument must implement `<<` <https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1959|rack/rack#1959>
> • `close` may be called on `rack.input` <https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1956|rack/rack#1956>
> • `rack.response_finished` may be used for executing code after the response has been finished <https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1952|rack/rack#1952>
> 
> *[3.0.0.beta1] - 2022-08-08*
> *Security*
> 
> • Do not use semicolon as GET parameter separator. (<https://github-redirect.dependabot.com/rack/rack/pull/1733|#1733>, [<https://github.com/jeremyevans|`@​jeremyevans`>])
> 
> *SPEC Changes*
> 
> • Response array must now be non-frozen.
> • Response `status` must now be an integer greater than or equal to 100.
> • Response `headers` must now be an unfrozen hash.
> • Response header keys can no longer include uppercase characters.
> • Response header values can be an `Array` to handle multiple values (and no longer supports `\n` encoded headers).
> • Response body can now respond to `#call` (streaming body) instead of `#each` (enumerable body), for the equivalent of response hijacking in previous versions.
